channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Holes in road from removal of studs/markings, 13th January
item.description:
On the B4063 between the fire station and entrance to Pirton Fields there are holes in the road from the removal of studs/road markings prior to the cycle lane being installed. These are noticeable holes that ideally require filling at least temporarily. It could be argued that the road needs attention since the works to install the cycle lane has caused a patchwork surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 street lights out in Willow close, 12th January
item.description:
Outside number 18 and 20 lights are out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Close, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Injury caused by sign not visible in dark, 12th January
item.description:
Sign denoting roadworks is in the middle of a very narrow pavement and cannot be seen in the dark in an ultra low light zone, which our village is. Sustained injury to face, almost knocking out front teeth. Sign hit with such force it hit the ground, despite being weighed down with a sandbag or equivalent. Extremely dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30,32, Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Side of road hole, 12th January
item.description:
It's on the "S bend" in Brimpsfield. Cars and water have damaged a large section of the side of the road making it a crater hole around the length of the bend. It is dangerous for cars.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birdlip Road, Cotswold

item.title: Leaf mould is blocking pavement and drains the whole length of Naunton Lane from Thirlestaine Rodcto Whitecross Square making the pavement dangerous and leaving the gullies impossible on one side for bikes and leaving water to splash pedestrians; the lane has not be cleared for months., 12th January
item.description:
See above

item.title: Large strip of interconnecting potholes causing cars to drive in the middle of the road., 12th January
item.description:
On Malleson Road towards A435 on the left hand side after the new houses. I received an e-mail from GCC - (Production) today as follows Web Reference: 5322634 Enquiry Number: 22035966 Issue: Pothole on the Carriageway Location: Large strip of interconnected potholes causing vehicles to drive in the middle of the road. Direction from Gotherington towards A435 Site: MALLESON ROAD The repair has now been completed. However the repair has not been made and there is no evidence of any attempt to do so. Anyone driving this stretch of road could not fail to notice the problem. The pin is in roughly the right place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight not working, 12th January
item.description:
Streelight on the junction of Redmarley Road / Priors Road in Cheltenham not working. This Streetlight is closet to the Sainsbury's Petrol sign next to the Pedestrian crossing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priors Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham

item.title: The pavement is frequently blocked by the vehicle shown in the image, forcing pedestrians, including children, onto the road. I note that your website suggests I involve the police, but when I call them they advise that the issue is one for the local authority to resolve., 12th January
item.description:
On eastern side of Copt Elm Road, Charlton Kings, near its junction with Lyefield Road East.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Copt Elm Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Filter lane turning red with main signal, 12th January
item.description:
Everytime the A40 westbound lights turn red, so do the filter lane lights for Benhall. There is absolutely no need for them to turn red unless there is a pedestrian crossing. This still happens in the middle of the night when they're are absolutely no pedestrians about. The lights did not no this before the bodged A40 works were undertaken. There is a seperate set of lights for the bus lane to stop them crossing the Benhall exit - when those lights are green. The filter lane does not need to turn red as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Half pathway blockef, 12th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Jardine Drive, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Awful litter,flytipping and graffiti, 12th January
item.description:
Hi, Between the M5 junction and the Longlevens turnoff there is an unbelievable amount of rubbish and flytipping. There’s also graffiti on the road bridges. It looks awful. Could this please be cleaned up? Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 12th January
item.description:
There are a couple of obstructions on a bridleway/restricted byway that have been there for sometime. This one is blocked by a fallen tree. Id be grateful if you are able to confirm if this is the correct place to report these issues Many thanks and best wishes
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 12th January
item.description:
There are a couple of obstructions on a bridleway/restricted byway that have been there for sometime. This one is blocked by a fallen telegraph pole and also a number of trees.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No-parking cones been put on the road with no notice of authorisation., 12th January
item.description:
A length of North Road East has had a number of no-parking cones put out along both sides of the road. There are no notices of any authorisation of parking restrictions. There is a road race on Sunday, they have apparently ’applied for’ permission, but in previous years have ‘closed’ the road with no authorisation. Even if it is for Sunday, blocking the road from Friday afternoon does not seem acceptable. The cones were so close together that I couldn’t even safely pull in to let someone past before I reversed into my drive today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Road East, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
